UI / UX Practices


Here are examples of user interface elements I worked on and how I approached reaching UX goals.

Aim: Grip players during loading screens, to minimize break points.

Achieved by:

Showing movement on the screen to keep the suspense high.

Setting the right movement speed for highest comfort and excitement, as well as dividing movement patterns of elements for greater variety and a richer experience.

Following the rules of animation such as anticipation and easing for a more pleasant, attractive visual result.

Displaying readable content, such as text or meaningful symbols, that players can recognize and decipher.

Reducing what is shown on the screen to guide the players' eyes more easily and keep information digestible.

Aim: Pick user's interest from the first moment after starting the application

Title menu with sprite replacement on hover

Start Game Settings

animations suggesting interactivity

Strategy:

Buttons function as gateways leading one further into the application. Therefore, they have to be alluring.

Making button interaction exciting through visual and auditory feedback when hovering over buttons and clicking them is an effective way to do that.
